page.title: 07Farming - Cheriton Bishop
page.content: The soil, heavy clay, a high rainfall and steep slopes make grass the most important crop for the 18 farms in this area, providing silage, hay and grazing. About 90% is grassland with the remainder used for barley, oats and wheat. Apart from the grain, wheat is also grown for thatching straw. The larger farms are generally mixed and include dairy, arable, beef cattle, sheep and grass crops, whilst the smaller, under 100 acres, are mainly beef cattle and sheep; one entirely for breeding pedigree Charolais cattle. Farms vary in size from over 300 acres to under 50, and include 6 dairy farms. 5 are over 200 acres and 11 under 100. 70% of the farms have been in the same hands for over 20 years.
